t: Job 5
“Call*pn if you will, but who will answer you? To*ld which of the holy ones will you turn?
Resentment*ln kills a fool, and*ld envy slays the simple.
I*ln myself have seen a fool taking root, but*ld suddenly his house was cursed.
His*ln children are far from safety, crushed*ld in court without a defender.
The*ln hungry consume his harvest, taking*ld it even from among thorns, and*ld the thirsty pant after his wealth.
For*ln hardship does not spring from the soil, nor*ld does trouble sprout from the ground.
Yet*ln man is born to trouble as*ld surely as sparks fly upward.
“But*pn if I were you, I would appeal to God; I*ld would lay my cause before him.
He*ln performs wonders that cannot be fathomed, miracles*ld that cannot be counted.
He*ln provides rain for the earth; he*ld sends water on the countryside.
The*ln lowly he sets on high, and*ld those who mourn are lifted to safety.
He*ln thwarts the plans of the crafty, so*ld that their hands achieve no success.
He*ln catches the wise in their craftiness, and*ld the schemes of the wily are swept away.
Darkness*ln comes upon them in the daytime; at*ld noon they grope as in the night.
He*ln saves the needy from the sword in their mouth; he*ld saves them from the clutches of the powerful.
So*ln the poor have hope, and*ld injustice shuts its mouth.
“Blessed*pn is the one whom God corrects; so*ld do not despise the discipline of the Almighty.
For*ln he wounds, but he also binds up; he*ld injures, but his hands also heal.
From*ln six calamities he will rescue you; in*ld seven no harm will touch you.
In*ln famine he will deliver you from death, and*ld in battle from the stroke of the sword.
You*ln will be protected from the lash of the tongue, and*ld need not fear when destruction comes.
You*ln will laugh at destruction and famine, and*ld need not fear the wild animals.
For*ln you will have a covenant with the stones of the field, and*ld the wild animals will be at peace with you.
You*ln will know that your tent is secure; you*ld will take stock of your property and find nothing missing.
You*ln will know that your children will be many, and*ld your descendants like the grass of the earth.
You*ln will come to the grave in full vigor, like*ld sheaves gathered in season.
“We*pn have examined this, and it is true. So*ld hear it and apply it to yourself.”
